topic: How to containerize WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to containerize WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Containerizing WASM Targets Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates how to create a containerized WebAssembly (WASM) application using FastAPI in Python 3.12+. It covers setting up the project, integrating WASM modules, and deploying the container.
key_points: Prerequisites: Docker, Python 3.12, FastAPI, WebAssembly (WASM) compatible browser
Create a main.py file for your FastAPI app
Integrate WASM modules in the FastAPI application
Set up Dockerfile and Docker Compose
Build and run the container locally

code_examples.code: pip install fastapi uvicorn websockets aiofiles docker compose

FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt

version_notes: FastAPI: Latest stable release (0.74.0 at the time of writing)
Uvicorn: Latest stable release (0.18.3 at the time of writing)
caveats: Ensure your WASM modules are compatible with WebAssembly System Interface (WASI) and WebAssembly STD.
Adjust code examples as necessary for different project requirements.
